section.title: Exercise: Setting up a target platform
Creating a target definition file
section.para:
Create a new project called com.example.rcp.target of type General via
File New Other... General Project
.

textobject.phrase: Create a project for your target definition file

section.para:
Create a new target definition file via the
File New Other... Plug-in Development Target Definition
menu path. Use the com.example.rcp.target as file name.

textobject.phrase: Add content to target definition file

section.para: Select Software site in the following dialog.

textobject.phrase: Add content to target definition file

section.para: Press the Next button and enter the update site URL of the target release in the Work with selection box. This is for example: http://download.eclipse.org/releases/neon for the Eclipse 4.6 (Neon) release.

Remove the Group by Category flag and add the following components:
Target components
Component Description
Eclipse Platform SDK Components for RCP
Equinox Target Components The native launchers for the platform, ensure to select the non "black and white" entry if this exists. This entry is empty.

After you close this dialog, the target definition is resolved, which will take a while. The result should look similar to the following screenshot. Please note that your version numbers might be different.

section.title: Activate your target platform
section.para:
Afterwards press the Set as Target Platform to activate it. See
in case you have problems with your new target platform.
To check if your definition is active, try to open the SpyHandler class via Ctrl+Shift+T (Open Type). This should not be possible.

section.title: Solving potential issues for development
section.para: Your target platform depends on external update sites and their packaging of plug-ins. Theses update sites might change over time, so you should be able to revert your target platform settings in case you face issues.

You can switch back to your Eclipse IDE as target platform via
Window Preferences Plug-in Development Target Platform
.

note.para: If you face issues with your target platform, try switching to the IDE as target platform and afterwards switch back to your definition. That sometimes solves target resolution issues.
